message_1: In a group of 5 people, how many different ways can you choose 3 people to form a committee?
message_2:
To find the number of ways to choose 3 people from a group of 5, we use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people (5 in this case) and k is the number of people we want to choose (3 in this case). The exclamation mark denotes the factorial of a number.

C(5, 3) = 5! / (3!(5-3)!)

C(5, 3) = 5! / (3!2!)

C(5, 3) = (5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(2 × 1))

C(5, 3) = (120) / (6 × 2)

C(5, 3) = 120 / 12

C(5, 3) = 10

So there are 10 different ways to choose 3 people from a group of 5 to form a committee.
